title: The Midas Curse
text: Your coffers overflow while the people scavenge for crumbs. The disparity offends the heavens. A mad prophet has appeared in the central square.

options.response: The prophet died laughing. The people now worship him as a martyr.
The gold is gone. The people applaud, but the nobles call you weak.

title: The Emperor General
text: Your army is so powerful it no longer needs you. The Marshal demands to be named 'Protector of the Realm'. It is a veiled coup.

options.response: You keep the crown, but have lost the sword.
The Marshal is dead. The army is in chaos.

title: The Golden Statue
text: Sycophants suggest erecting a statue of you in solid gold in the main square.

options.response: It shines under the sun, blinding the beggars.
The people praise your mercy.

title: The Paradox of Faith
text: You claim to be a 'Holy King' (Theocracy), but your coffers are filled with gold stained by usury. The Pope demands an explanation.

options.response: The Pope accepted the bribe. God may not accept it.
Publicly humiliated, but forgiven.

title: The Satirical Bard
text: A popular play ridicules your court. They portray you as a crowned donkey surrounded by wolves.

options.response: The laughter stopped, but the hatred grew.
You disarmed the criticism with good humor.

title: The Poisoning
text: Your food taster dropped dead during dinner. Someone in the court wants your crown.

options.response: Many innocents died to catch one culprit.
The culprit was found and quietly exiled.

title: Silent Famine
text: There is no war, no plague. Just incompetent administration. The people die of hunger silently in the alleyways.

options.response: The silence of the dead is deafening.
You feed the people by selling the kingdom's future.

title: The Last Loan
text: The treasury is empty. The Iron Bank offers a loan, but demands control of the royal mines as collateral.

options.response: Gold today, misery tomorrow.
The priests curse your name, but the bills are paid.

title: The Neighbor's Offer
text: The Iron Kingdom sees your military weakness and offers 'protection' in exchange for tribute.

options.response: Peace was bought with honor.
They will come. Be ready.

title: Barbarian Invasion
text: Hordes from the north have breached the border. They do not want land, they want blood and gold.

options.response: They left laden with gold. They will return next year.
A pyrrhic victory. The field is stained red.

title: Mercenary Betrayal
text: Your mercenaries have not received their pay. Now they threaten to sack the capital if not paid double.

options.response: They take the gold and laugh at your weakness.
Battle in the streets. The traitors were slaughtered.

title: Banquet of Nobles
text: Times of peace and gold. The nobles celebrate your wisdom with an extravagant festival.

options.response: Wine and pheasant. The people watch from the gates.
They found the joke in poor taste and hid their jewelry.

title: The Black Plague
text: Merchant ships brought more than spices. The dry cough turned to black pustules. Death walks the streets.

options.response: The economy halted, but the city survived.
The crowds only spread the disease faster.

title: Cursed Harvest
text: A fungus has destroyed the wheat fields. Winter approaches and the granaries are empty.

options.response: The treasury bleeds, but the people eat.
Peasant revolts erupted in the countryside.

title: The Red Comet
text: A trail of blood crosses the night sky. The peasants say it is the end of times.

options.response: It is merely ice and dust, the sages say.
The people are calmed by goat's blood.

title: The Heretic Philosopher
text: A scholar claims the Earth revolves around the Sun, contradicting the sacred scriptures.

options.response: Fire purifies, but the truth persists.
The Church is furious, but the world advances.

title: The New Cathedral
text: The Bishop wishes to build the largest cathedral in the world for the glory of God (and himself).

options.response: A marvel of stone that will last a thousand years.
The Bishop preaches about the avarice of kings on Sunday.

title: Weavers' Revolt
text: New machines brought from abroad produce cloth faster, taking jobs from local artisans.

options.response: Progress is inevitable, as is the misery of some.
The machines were smashed. Tradition was maintained.

title: Peasant Uprising
text: Fed up with taxes and hunger, the peasants have armed themselves with scythes and march on the castle.

options.response: You ceded power to keep your head.
The fields were fertilized with corpses.

title: The Rebel Prince
text: Your heir publicly disagrees with your policies. He is young, charismatic, and dangerous.

options.response: You kept the power, but lost the future.
He is busy governing, far from the capital.

title: The Gunpowder Plot
text: Barrels of gunpowder were found beneath Parliament. Discontent nobles planned to blow it all up.

options.response: Fear maintains order better than loyalty.
Justice was done, but they became martyrs.

title: Judicial Error
text: Your secret police arrested an innocent man, a war hero loved by the people. The truth has come out.

options.response: The secret police lost authority, but the people respect your honesty.
He was executed as a traitor. The lie became truth.

title: Silver Fleet Shipwreck
text: Storms destroyed the ships bringing gold from the colonies. The investment is lost.

options.response: The people pay for the failure of the sea.
The sea gives, the sea takes.

title: The Miracle Fountain
text: Peasants say a fountain in the countryside cures diseases. Pilgrims are blocking the roads.

options.response: Faith is a profitable business.
The place became sacred in your name.

title: Mass Desertion
text: Your soldiers are tired of endless wars and little food. An entire regiment has deserted.

options.response: Discipline was restored by terror.
They fight, but the coffers weep.

title: Day of Audience
text: No army marches, no plague ravages. Just a line of peasants with disputes over fences and goats.

options.response: The people love a king who listens.
Efficient bureaucracy is the foundation of the realm.

title: The Weather Turns
text: A summer storm floods some cellars, but waters the crops.

options.response: Your presence comforts the affected.
The rain passes, the reign continues.

title: Minor Festival
text: It is Saint Nobody's day. The people dance in the square.

options.response: A small price for smiles.
The work continues.
